info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 01 at 4:45PM CDT until July 01 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL CLINTON...WASHINGTON...EASTERN RANDOLPH AND EASTERN ST. CLAIR COUNTIES... At 444 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Freeburg to near Bremen, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Mascoutah, Sparta, Scott AFB, Steeleville, Marissa, Percy, Coulterville, and Tilden around 450 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include New Baden, Albers, Lively Grove, New Memphis, Aviston, Okawville, Germantown, Breese, Nashville, Carlyle, Beckemeyer, Ashley, Centralia, Wamac, Irvington and Shattuc. This includes Interstate 64 in Illinois between exits 23 and 61. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
